movie_name: Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
review_detailed_main: Any movie by Larry the Cable Guy is going to fall into the "so-stupid-it's-funny" genre, but this movie failed to meet even these requirements because it was extremely stupid, but by no means funny. I have nothing against Larry the Cable Guy and I've found his performances on the Blue Collar Comedy Tours hilarious, but this movie was by nowhere near hilarious. It will have you thinking twice before ever eating in a restaurant for the rest of your natural life (you may not want to eat snacks while watching this movie, or depending on your stomach, before this movie). The movie focuses on Larry the Cable Guy who is no longer "the Cable Guy" but now a quasi-rogue health inspector. According to different plot summaries of the movie, Larry has to try to solve a mystery involving a chain of food poisonings, but what they fail to mention is that these food poisonings do not, as I suspected, cause death but instead cause diarrhea and horrible gas. Larry does deliver a few funny one-liners, but toilet humor is everywhere and distracts from anything that might come off as funny anywhere else. The movie's jokes may be considered offensive to many different types of people including, but not limited to the crippled, Indians, the mentally challenged, homosexuals, and even anyone that has only one eyebrow (some may even claim that it is insulting to African Americans and Caucasians depending on how you take a few jokes). This movie is not funny, but is so rude and disgusting that it is beyond description and can be only compared to "The Fly". The problem with this movie is not that it is ignorant (different characters make comments on how rude and disgusting Larry is), but that it was produced/directed/created by an individual with a very twisted sense of humor. The movie's plot makes sense (although I wish it didn't) and if you find gross-out humor funny, you could find this movie being a 2/10. If you don't vaguely like the gross and disgusting side of humor, avoid this movie like the plague because dead flies, rats, cockroaches, trash-filled trucks, and cases of horrible gas are shown frequently in the movie. If you want to see it, wait until it comes to television.

movie_name: Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
review_title: Juvenile, Crass, and idiotic all of which would be fine were it funny, which it's not.
review_detailed_main:
Larry (Larry the Cable Guy) is a big city health inspector with questionable practices and his own way of doing things. Larry's boss, Bart Tatlock (Tom Wilson), irritated with complaints against Larry and the department, assigns Larry a new partner, Amy Butlin (Iris Bahr), a by-the-book professional who takes the job seriously. She tries to learn the ropes of health inspection while putting up with Larry and his personality while investigating a rash of poisonings at high end restaurants.

Released in 2006 to negative reviews and poor box office, Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector was an experiment in capitalizing on the success of the Blue Collar Comedy Tour which from 2000 to 2006 had seen massive success in direct to video productions, concerts, and other merchandise. Initially destined for a direct-to-video release Paramount opted for a theatrical release before transferring the rights to Lionsgate. The movie didn't wow with critics or the box office and rightly so because it is not good.

When the film opens with a full shot of Larry the Cable Guy's plumber's crack and takes us through his morning routine of stepping on discarded pizza, saving used q-tips, and pissing in the shower, it's clear the movie isn't aiming very high. The schtick on display doesn't get much better once he steps outside his hovel with embarrassing gags like David Koechner playing a man with special needs or Larry repeatedly thinking Amy Butlin is a man and spouting a bunch of tired gay panic jokes with no real build up, set up or pay off and just limply hang there. There's really nothing else to say about this film, it's a movie, it's in color, the sound mixing is well done so you and hear and see everything clearly. Even if you like Larry the Cable Guy's stand-up you're probably not going to like this movie. Most of the time it's just a series of gross out jokes that are tired and played out and no real substance or reason to exist.

movie_name: Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
review_title: Is Larry supposed to be funny?...is he ever funny?
review_detailed_main:
Maybe five minutes tops but at ten minutes he's agenizing repetitive and misfiring.

I've watched a few of his standup routines and could never make it past the six minute mark.

It's really not the joke writers fault but the Larry persona brand...he's just not funny, the in your face yokelism is cringy and it shows in the mean spiritedness of "Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector" Hitting a dry well with his only trade mark character he looks disparate trying to be funny dredging in the muck ,the longer he hams the camera the more his one dimensional yokel shtick misfires.

I mean how many times can you guffaw hearing "Git-r-Done" What am I five years old?

Where's a John Candy/James Varney redneck mix ,that would be entertaining but Larry just comes across as unlovable, annoying and overbearing, being slovenly is not funny just by itself ... "know what I mean Vern"

Inserting a hapless romantic side story into this awful movie just seemed so abusive to the poor girl and me watching.

Also Larry's boyish health inspector sidekick was constantly pummeled by this troglodyte...I felt repulsed and was hoping Larry would get fired for being a bullying slovenly unfunny halfwit, Jim Carrey had a dumb & dumber charm while Larry just comes across like a oinkng pig in a china shop.

Story +1 ,cute romantic interest +1, Larry persona -10.

movie_name: Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
review_title: Great fun for Larry the Cable Guy fans!
review_detailed_main: I was slightly hesitant to check out this movie, since I read a boatload of terrible reviews on this site. I expect bad reviews from critics, I expect bad reviews from those who despise Larry the Cable Guy--but I don't expect bad reviews from fans of Larry. Even most of the people who enjoy his comedy didn't like the film. But I finally picked up the DVD and lo and behold, I was laughing...a lot. The plot is no gem, but that didn't bother me. This wasn't meant to be an intelligent, plot-driven comedy. It was meant to be a comedy vehicle for Larry, and as that, it succeeds. Sure, the humor is low-brow and there are plenty of toilet gags. What the hell do you expect? Have you ever seen Larry's stand-up? I can't deny that I wasn't laughing out loud when Larry was on the John, couldn't find any toilet paper, and uses a towel to wipe himself. And as I hoped, the movie contains plenty of the comedians hilarious one-liners. So if you're not a fan, stay away! Nobody's forced you to watch the damn movie! If you, like me, are a fan--then enjoy the show. The movie is not pretentious. It doesn't try to be anything more than a brainless comedy flick. I was feeling in a terrible mood when I watched the movie, and it definitely cheered me up. I'm sorry, but if I'm in a bad mood, I'd much rather watch "Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector" than "Gone with the Wind." The actors all seem to be having fun, even veteran character Joe Pantoliano (who bares a striking resemblance to Clint Howard in the film). The lead actress is cute, there are several cool songs in the soundtrack (including "I Want to Know What Love Is" by Foreigner). I have very few complaints. Whether they admit it or not, every person at least sporadically craves to just check their brains at the door, kick back with a couple beers, and watch a low-brow comedy of this nature. I appreciate great films like "Crash" or "American Beauty" or "Goodfellas." Just because I can enjoy a movie of this sort doesn't make me a Neanderthal.

movie_name: Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
review_title: It was so funny I was crying....
review_detailed_main: I did like this movie. I was not expecting it to be so funny! Come on people your telling me you did not laugh at all at this movie? yea right it at least made you giggle. I have to admit I didn't think it was going to be sooo good but it was. It WAS silly , but everyone in the theater was laughing and there were a lot of people almost a full house so it wasn't just me. It made me laugh. It is just a fun silly movie to go see. Not very much cussing at all and no bad scenes so just cause there were no sex or violence its a bad movie? It had gross scenes I guess but they were even funny. ANd I am a girly type of movie watcher. ANyways if you want to laugh till you cry watch this movie.

movie_name: Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
review_detailed_main:
After reading the reviews on this site I was sure that this movie was going to be absolutely horrible. I thought the movie was crude but funny. Obviously if you've ever listed to Larry the Cable Guy's comedy, he makes plenty of fart jokes and isn't afraid of the tasteless. The movie is pretty much more of the same. It had decent characters and even though the plot wasn't Academy Award winning, it was more than what I expected.

Bottom line, if you didn't like Larry the Cable Guy before this movie, you probably won't like him after watching it. If you think redneck jokes are funny, you'll enjoy it. If you're one of those people who are easily offended or overly political correct, you might as well not bother.

movie_name: Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
review_title: It's a Scary Movie for Buddy Comedies with a lot of farting.
review_detailed_main:
Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector is not a bad movie. It's actually pretty funny. Even though many complain that all the characters are cardboard cutouts of cop movies, I think this is intentional. I believe that this movie is meant more of a parody of buddy cop comedies than anything else.

Larry is pretty funny, though I think he works better at stand-up comedy because he doesn't have any limitations of plot. The rest of the cast was pretty good, especially Butlin (the boy.) The movie had a bit of odd social commentary. It seemed as though Larry had some anti-racist beliefs. He would let health inspections slide more for those who had not been in the U.S. as long, and Big Shug (a black man with great fried chicken... I guess that's stereotype) was somewhat of the hero.

The movie actually had a few tense scenes. It doesn't deserve to be in the Bottom 100.

movie_name: Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
review_detailed_main: Very funny! From start to about the last ten minutes, last ten minutes kinda drags by, but then the credits outtakes do it justice. In order to watch this movie be very perceptive and look past the actors as well for other gimmicks included in the movie. Lots of one-liners to keep everybody laughing. All of the actors do a great job I believe in this show, and even those not so "new" to the scene. Larry in Bible College? When does Larry the Cable Guy "Pastor" come out? That would be a hoot. Sit back have fun and prepare to laugh, especially at Larry's soon to be mother-in-law. I couldn't stop laughing through out the entire show, have fun.

movie_name: Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
review_detailed_main: I don't think this movie was half bad. Some of Larry's comedy was enough to give me several chuckles, and it was basically fun to see Larry be himself in the whole movie. I've seen worse comedy movies, like I-SPY with Eddie Murphy. I fell asleep the first time I watched that, and I have a sensitive funny bone! Sure, the storyline was kind of weak, and some of the supporting cast was bad too, it was still a nice fun romp of a movie. Larry's jokes were also fun to listen to, and I absolutely enjoyed his Larrymobile(truck). As Larry would say about this movie, "It's funny, I don't care who you all are, that movie's funny right there!"

movie_name: Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
review_title: Take it for what it is.
review_detailed_main: I read a sampling of the other reviews, and find I'm in agreement with the few that thought this movie was entertaining. But, as others have noted, you HAVE to be a fan of Larry to get it. If you've never seen/heard him perform, then a lot of the one liners might seem very offensive. As in his act, he plays a naive "redneck" who is unintentionally insulting, and I, for one, find it to be rather funny. Yes, there is a good bit of bathroom humor, but, unlike some of the opinions, I don't think it was overly done, and I also thought the acting was rather good. I imagine the crew had a lot of fun making this movie, and that comes through the performances. I'm a middle-aged family man of normal intelligence, have pretty eclectic tastes regarding art, and don't follow NASCAR, and this movie made me laugh. I've seen some movies that have garnered some pretty good ratings on this site that I thought didn't deserve them, and I've seen others with terrible ratings that didn't deserve those either. This movie should rate no lower than a five. I don't know what people were expecting when they saw it, but take it for what it is, and you'll find yourself entertained.

movie_name: Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
review_detailed_main:
Greetings, I work for a Legal Department in a city and often have to help the Health Inspector close a restaurant or fill in for the inspector when needed.

I thought it was very FUNNY.

Larry does go over the top, that what he does! This is not Shakespeare and if you read and paid attention to the rating, "Rated PG-13 for crude and sexual content, and for language.", you would have known not to bring the kids.

Larry is not for the PC crowd and that's a good thing. Now that's funny right there, I don't care who you are.

I think the people that did not like this movie because of Larry, did not like him to start with.

Best regards, Ferd

movie_name: Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
review_title: Not a stand up act but a good movie
review_detailed_main: This one gets a six from me, I was initially expecting a stand up act but I quickly realised (mid-movie) that I wasn't getting one. Its a good chance for Larry to elaborate on his redneck character with a movie budget but the quantity of fart jokes is not for everyone. I can see reviews from people disappointed that this isn't a stand up act and I must stress that this is more of a rush-hour style movie with chemistry developing between the characters and larry as the protagonist. Once you understand this its a nice family movie. You can tell everyone making the movie is having a hilarious time and it pushes through the screen.

movie_name: Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
review_detailed_main: OK, so this is not going to win any awards for being a great movie or a great screenplay, or pretty much a great anything. However, if you like Larry the Cable Guy and redneck humor you're going to love this film. It is Larry at his best. It is predictable and filled with some of Larry's classics, fart jokes, his sister, being a redneck, playing dumb. But hey that is what Larry is all about. If you do not like Larry's stand up routines or Blue Collar Comedy routines you will not enjoy this film. In the genre of dumb comedy, this is one of the best. All-in-all, if you want a great laugh this will do it if you want to see a great film rent Doctor Zhivago.

movie_name: Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
review_detailed_main: There are those that recoil in terror at the seemingly repetitive themes in Larry the Cable Guy's major works, I respectfully digress that all great movies are about life and death, fear and triumph, love and loss. We must ask ourselves, is our life such as a catfish scented Igloo cooler? I say that it is. After all, is it not the basis of life, to worry about such troubling issues as to hang out with Kid Rock, or slobber over Pamela Anderson Lee whatever her last name is this year? Layer upon layer of intricate meaning, tackling other bothersome societal ills such as inbreeding, juvenile delinquent behavior well into adulthood, and even the perennial question "Who farted?". Indeed. Well thought out, Larry the Cable guy. You truly are a deep observer of humanity.

movie_name: Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
review_detailed_main:
This probably has the worst screenplay of any movie ever made. Worse than THE PIANO, even worse than THE English PATIENT. The direction is uninspired so the supporting cast (who are probably very capable) didn't do their best, and it's photographed like a sitcom with flat lighting in the interiors.

But it's got Larry, and that made it worth the $5.50 any day.

Plus, it's encouraging that this was at least made in the United States, in Orlando, Florida and at the Universal Studios there. It seems like half the movies showing now are made in Canada with American money.

People have a delusion that what works on the live stage or in a thirty minute TV show is going to make a great movie. Not necessarily. If HEALTH INSPECTOR were a series, this would be one thirty minute episode. With titles and ads that would be about twenty-two minutes of show. This is four times that long (plus a minute) and it moves as slowly as a glacier. And the plot (something about a cookoff to see who's the best chef in the city) is way more complicated than need be.

Larry has created a wonderful character, and I'd like to see him try another movie with a real director and real writers. It could be dynamite.

He plays a modern day Will Rogers who (between farts) dispenses folksy wisdom. The screenplay brings on a string of bureaucrats, self important politicians and snobs for him to shoot down with his easygoing humor. Unfortunately, mere seconds into the film we see a closeup of Larry's buttcrack showing above his boxers. This is an indicator of what's to come.

He's teamed up with Amy, a new, by-the-book rookie health inspector. Thank goodness there's no attempt to start a romance with her and Larry (though much of the film he thinks Amy's a gay man, an illusion she disabuses him of in a hilarious scene involving a hidden microphone), but she's lucky in one respect. If she'd partnered with Clint Eastwood in a DIRTY HARRY movie her character would have been dead three fourths of the way through the story.

Larry deserves another movie. I'm looking forward to it.

Fart jokes can be funny. There's a scene in a fancy restaurant with two yuppies on a romantic date that turns into a symphony of farts, but that can only get you so much mileage out of that.

Better luck next time, Larry.

movie_name: Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
review_detailed_main:
"I walked into the theater hoping I would get some good laughs. I went with my friend who worships Larry's humor. I left the theater disappointed. This movie is filled with the same joke over and over again. Basically overdone toilet humor. I have nothing against the humor, it's just the same jokes repeated over and over again. Nothing new or inventive here. Larry's humor was not creative. Just diarrhea jokes over and over throughout the whole entire movie! And that was the whole running gimmick!"

What the heck? it wasn't filmed to be an Oscar winner.

Larry is one funny SOB! great movie 7/10 from me. i hope he does more movies. yes there was a lot of bathroom humor but thats not larry's fault as much as the writers fault. Anyone who likes larry and wants to laugh should go rent the DVD when it comes out support the redneck comedy! I hope it catches on as good as the black comedy movies like Friday, White Chicks etc...

Country Music is already taken over why not movies? I'm still laughing from this movie!

Get-R-Done!

movie_name: Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
review_detailed_main: This is Larry's first movie & the best of the three he has done so far. Delta Farce & Witless Protection are the other 2. I don't include the Cars movies because those are animated. Health Inspector came out in 2006 & made enough money to insure Larry's career. Although it is a comedy most people overlook the tender romance between Larry & Jane. Of course in real life no girl would ever give their phone number to Larry. But in the movies unusual things can happen. Jane's mother is played by Lisa Lampanelli. I didn't recognize her at first. It was only after repeated viewings it dawned on me. Hey that's the chick who hosts those celebrity roasts! My favorite scene is the one with the rats. The pairing of Larry and Butlin is inspired. Why doesn't Bruce Bruce get more work. He's a natural. Unfortunately as Larry gets bigger & bigger he may loose some of the innocence of his early work. I hope not. I hope he never goes legitimate.

movie_name: Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
review_title: This movie's funny. I don't care who you are, it's funny.
review_detailed_main: I don't know why most newspaper movie critics said this movie wasn't all that great, but I believe they are awfully wrong. Matter of fact, us movie goers do a better job criticizing movies than most "professinoal" movie critics can. I loved this movie (That's right, GIT-R-DONE). I was interested since the first time I watched the trailer. From what I saw in the movie, a lot of Larry's stand-up comedy bits were applied, especially visiting the lingerie store. Not one bad scene in this movie at all. I recommend this movie as a must-see for all Larry the Cable Guy or Blue Collar Comedy Tour fans. This movie, in what would appear to be Larry's terms :"That's funny right there. I don't care who you are, that's funny right there." Remember, GIT-R-DONE.

movie_name: Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
review_title: plain humor, dumb, stupid, and I laughed so hard I cracked a rib
review_detailed_main:
I went to see Larry the cable guy last week with my son. we both thought it was extremely funny. we are not red necks and both have very high I.Q.'s, but this was a great break from the normal movies we see together. I think as far as funny movies go it was one of the best. the whole theater was in stitches the whole movie. their are a few slow parts, and the plot gets kind of confusing, but I have to say I find Larry in this movie very funny, even though I am not a fan of his stand up.

it's funny how many people write that don't like this movie. I guess they are the ones who go see the stupid horror and demonic films out their not to mention the filth that Hollywood puts out.

So if you want to see a good clean movie go see Larry the cable guy's new one. peeing in the shower and all.

movie_name: Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
review_title: not as bad as everyone says
review_detailed_main: I thought it was an alright movie. From everyones opinion's, this movie was garbage, I thought it was pretty funny throughout the whole movie. Not the greatest comedy I've seen, but if you have never seen Larry the cable guy, you wouldn't like this movie. It could of definitely been better, but there was something missing in the movie to make it more entertaining. It is pretty funny that he thinks her partner is a man throughout the movie. I don't think i would see this movie again, but I think if you have heard of Larry the cable guy and seen him, you'll like this movie, if you haven't, this movie isn't for you. I'm giving it a 8 because Larry is pretty funny, and the story seemed pretty easy to track and was pretty good.

movie_name: Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
review_title: Is this a movie? Yes it is, and it is much more
review_detailed_main: Once in a generation, a movie will come along that will change your life. Such a movie is Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector. Based on the 15th century novella by Shakespeare entitled "Boobs Boobs Everywhere", this is the kind of timeless classic that will define our generation. Men of the last 1000 years? How about Albert Einstein, Abraham Lincoln, Ghandi, Jesus, and Larry The Cable Guy. This Larry guy is the kind of slack-jawed, fresh-faced, young upstart that will likely attract hordes of fans. He has that kind of hip-hop urban appeal that African American males will love. His smart, campy humor has become the voice of a generation. I submit that we rename December 25th "Larry The Cable Guy Day". Move over Jesus, your ass is getting kicked to the curb. What have you done for us lately? It is the age of Larry now.

movie_name: Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
review_detailed_main:
If you've seen Larry on the Blue Collar Comedy Tour, then you should be prepared for the movie. His comedy act is toilet humor, crude jokes, and not at all PC. His movie is no different. The movie lives up to what anyone can expect from a Larry the Cable Guy movie. If you liked him in the Blue Collar shows, you should like him in this movie.

The movie was worth seeing, and I plan to see it again, and so does my boyfriend.

Actually, I plan to get this movie on DVD when it comes out.

And then I'll watch it over and over again, and continue to laugh at the jokes, because they are funny.

movie_name: Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
review_detailed_main:
this was an awesome movie and i don't care if this is a 1 and a half star movie i laughed the crap out of myself.

it is so funny i swear there should be a sequel i think it would of been better if Jeff fox-worthy would of been it i also thought it would of been better if button was actually a guy. It also should of been longer come on, you have to make it two hours to at least be a good movie. I think Larry did a good job for his first big movie, you have to five him some credit, if you watch it you will change your mind about what you think. It was funny, had you guessing, what more could you want.

movie_name: Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
review_detailed_main:
About a year ago, I found a very interesting phrase. That phrase, as some of you probably already know, is "Git 'R Done!" I've thought to myself, "What in the world does that mean?" After some time, I found a DVD of the original comedy show by Larry the Cable Guy, and it said on the cover: "Git 'R Done!" Now, I began to know what the heck that odd phrase of his meant!

After Larry the Cable Guy's success on his original comedy bit, this movie, "Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector," was produced. Think of this as more of a gigantic, big-screen version of his first comedy show. He is a very funny guy, and if he were a real cable guy in my hometown, I'd ask him to set up an HD box for me!

10 stars!

movie_name: Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
review_detailed_main: I loved this movie! It is one of the funniest movies I have seen in 2006. You know, many people have been saying how bad it is, but I found it to be an extremely hilarious film. I'm not listening to anyone else. My opinion is, as follows: LARRY THE CABLE GUY IS A FUNNY PERSON. Why can't people at least give him respect? The movie was very funny, and he did a great job depicting the daily life of a redneck person. Thank you Larry for giving the world this funny film to show us how trailer trash makes life very fun. I love the comedy acts he does on television, and this movie was just as funny as his TV act. I wish there would be a sequel. I would sure as heck see it.

movie_name: Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
review_title: This movie is redneckishly funny and it gits a 10
review_detailed_main:
you know I'm 15 years old and i am a redneck. I'm speaking for three of my friends and myself as well, its funny how most peoples reviews i've read have bashed this movie, at least it ain't no film called gilgi or whatever that one was with Jennifer Lopez in it. Anyways, Larry The Cable Guy: Health Inspector was very funny to me and it was amusing right as it came on. I couldn't stop laughing. I like the Larry mobile

His humor expressed in this movie was vigilant. I enjoyed it all, and I'm buying this one on DVD. So, if your not sure on seeing it or renting it, you should if you like to laugh because trust me you will laugh, and its my new favorite movie bumping out some kind of monster.

movie_name: Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
review_detailed_main: the movie is a great one i never stop ed laughing i think its the funniest movie i have seen in a long time hope then come up with a next one. I am totally going out and buying this one. i love the get-r-done part it makes me laugh so much over all think if this author makes another movie like think or another funny movie lie this he will make millions. I love it when the swore in the movie and all the cock roaches coming out of the boards in the beginning that was really scary i hid behind a blanket i hate bugs and that big fat black guy he was so funny oh my god i am going to go watch that movie again right now its just that good

movie_name: Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
review_detailed_main: I took my 11 year old son to this movie because I know that he loves this type of humor. I went in with an open mind, but still thinking "what can you really expect from a movie starring Larry the Cable Guy?" It was very funny and I was surprised that the plot, albeit predictable, was very entertaining! Larry's genuine hillbilly sweetness makes everyone fall in love with him. Pretty good acting abilities for a someone who I thought was just a comedian! The entire (packed) movie theater was laughing from the opening scene to the closing outtakes. I recommend this movie if you want an easy watch and a good time at the movies.

movie_name: Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
review_detailed_main: To watch this you have to love Larry the Cable guy anyway. If your a prude this isn't for you. It has some raw humor but is rated PG-13. I think this age really applies to this movie. If you kids are younger don't take them. I see a lot of movies but I can say I have never ever laughed so hard at any movie in my whole life. I was wiping the tears from my face for hours. The whole movie is funny. Its not just the preview parts you see on TV. I would see this everyday until its not playing anymore if I could. I am truly going to buy this when it comes out on DVD. You will not waste any money on this one. Have fun and enjoy!

movie_name: Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
review_title: One of the best Dawgum movin' pitchers ever maid
review_detailed_main:
More boobies than you can shake a stick at and plenty of commode scenes. I bet they had to bring one of them farty cows in for backup. Princess Leah looked great as a boy and I think I went to grade school with that one girl. It's got Cypher from that thar Matrix movin pitcher too.

This pitcher is politicly correct. You got your retards, your asians, your homosexuals and democrats. Oh yeah and the mean guy from Back to the Future.

I highly recommend you'ins watch this here movin pitcher after about a case of Pabst Blue Ribbon to fully enjoy it. I reckon.

movie_name: Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
review_detailed_main: I do not understand why others thought this movie was a bust. My husband and I attended this movie 3 weeks after it was over on a tuesday evening and the whole screening room was packed! Throughout the entire movie all you could hear was laughter one person almost fell out in the floor laughing so hard. My husband does not laugh at a lot, and he laughed the entire movie. I laughed so much that my stomach and cheeks hurt. If people watch the blue collar comedy tour they know that Larry speaks a lot about gas and "redneck" things, so exactly what were they expecting out of the movie? Roses? Anyhow I thought it was the funniest movie I have ever seen. I cannot wait for it to come out on DVD.

movie_name: Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
review_detailed_main: Although I think this movie is quite safe from ever being bombarded by Oscars, one can't help but be entertained by the brain-numbing comedy this film offers. This is probably one of the worst films of the year, but it's a refreshing change to the seamlessly endless trend of re-makes and sequels. This is anything but a romantic comedy and probably a poor choice for taking a date to. Don't go see this movie if you feel the need for intellectual stimulation because there is nothing intellectual about it. This movie is a tribute to the term "lack of sophistication." The movie left me laughing out loud, while shaking my head in disbelieve. This is generally not my kind of movie, but I gave it a rating of "7" because I found it entertaining and, even though I'm ashamed to admit it, it made me laugh. Do go see this movie if you are not offended by offensive humor.

movie_name: Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
review_detailed_main:
Larry the Cable Guy is downright hilarious in this film. This film will be an awesome treat for fans, and, yes, it's gross humor. There's a very funny bathroom scene, among other things. Larry is a wonderful comedian, and my sides hurt from laughing so hard at several points during the movie.

In this film, Larry is a city health inspector, and he lives in a junky house in this film. He has a neighbor who is a retard. One thing that I found refreshing was that this film was sort an of anti-Brokeback Mountain. With homosexuality being glorified everywhere you go, it's refreshing to see a movie where it is put in its place. Because of general hilariousness, and because of Larry's position on the issue I mentioned above, I will make a point of seeing any future movies he makes, on opening weekend. With all the trash that's come out of Hollywood lately, it's nice to have a movie that's actually worth the price of a ticket.

movie_name: Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
review_title: If you need a easy movie to watch and a good laugh
review_detailed_main:
I don't see how people can say they hated this movie.

There is some gross stuff in it but I must say peeing in the shower is actually sanitary so maybe Larry is smarter than we realize. I mean after all he was the health inspector.

But this is a good easy movie to watch, get some good laughs, question what goes on inside his head and just have a good time. There honestly haven't been too many good comedies lately and this one while not being a high budget major Hollywood film did actually provide the laughs and that's what counts. So I say good job to all who worked on this movie it did what it was made to do.

movie_name: Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
review_detailed_main: Not bad for a Larry the Cable Guy film. It shouldn't have been nominated for a Razzie though. It's kinda worth seeing, but at the same though its kinda worth owning. It wasn't as good as Git-R-Done. I liked the fart jokes and the retard. It's pretty good, but more 8 star worthy. So the only time you might wanna see this is only if you're not eating. It's about this silly health inspector who has a new partner that's not all that beautiful. Then he is infatuated with this girl at the panty store. Then there is something in the food that makes everyone puke and all. It's something you may not want to eat and watch at the same time. But rent for some good laughs. Git-R-Done.

movie_name: Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
review_detailed_main:
Well I enjoyed this movie a lot. Not just because I'm always told I should be Larry's look a Like or stunt double. But the humor is some of the greatest ever written into such a clean arrangement.

Comedy has many different flavors, Larry The Cable Guys "Get R Done" has been a contagious phrase that you can hear from a restroom at Denny's to the Restroom at the Waffle house, but the blue is one that satisfied many comedy lovers for many years. Thanks to everyone who has supported our blue humor all these years.

I enjoy saying Gator Done! I get away with that at ever event. We say Hoe Hum or Yeee Haaaa to get a sentence to become shorter than normal. Thanks again for all the love and support.

Comedian Kevin Nicks.

movie_name: Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
review_detailed_main:
Larry the Cable guy is a very funny comic but his movie is awful. It is very gross (lots of farting). There are funny parts that will make you laugh. Overall it is very silly. The plot is simple to figure out - who done it!

In some scenes you can see the microphone hanging down - now that is a low budget flick!

Unless you a hardcore Larry fan don't waste your money going to see it, this is a movie to rent at best. If you like Larry catch him on TV, many of the same jokes are used in the movie.

I would much rather see an Ernest movie. They are a lot funnier.

movie_name: Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
review_detailed_main: You gotta see this movie if you like Larry. Even if just to upset the nay sayers. It is amazing how many people come out of the woodwork to try and discredit the man. " I went to school with him."," Larry isn't even his real name." Come on people find another place to vent because people who have fun in life and understand real humor will watch it. They enjoy it. The movie isn't supposed to be Shakespeare it's supposed to be funny. It does live up to that. If you like his stand up and you like his radio commentary then you will love this movie. It's rude, and it's crude, but definitely not lude. Larry has a real winner with this one. I can't spoil it but I can say this. Not one person wasn't laughing at the jokes in the movie theatre!! Now that's funny right there, I don't care who you are. That's funny right there. Enjoy!

movie_name: Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
review_title: I loved it! Don't mind the snowflake 1 star raters.
review_detailed_main: Don't pay attention to the star rating. This is actually a funny movie. It is being downplayed by the politically correct. Notice how all the bad reviews say, "I'm a big Larry fan, but..." If they were truly big Larry fan, they would love this movie because he is doing exactly what people love him for! Larry did a great job! I recommend it 100%! Watch it. It will not disappoint.

movie_name: Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
review_title: if it's so not funny then why are you laughing?
review_detailed_main: I took my little cousin to see this movie and I don't like movies or my little cousin very much, so I was prepared for the worst. and yet there I was, and there you were, laughing the whole time. literally. parents, kids, morons and men of intellect, all laughing the whole time. it may be low-brow low-brow low-brow humor, but you can't argue with people laughing, and that's what happens when this movie is screened. maybe all you haters don't hate the movie, you hate yourselves for laughing at the movie. and you should hate yourselves, you're probably terrible people. just a guess. And Trent can direct. you seen his shorts? hilarious. now go see V for vendetta. that's a crap movie.

movie_name: Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
review_detailed_main: If your watching a good FUNNY movie you don't need to think "now why is that funny" in health inspector i never had to wonder why something was funny i just got it. I didn't sit up in bed that night and say i get it now! I got it when it was given. Other funny movies you sometimes have to ask yourself why that is funny and sometimes it comes to you in bed! Health inspector was great i loved it, i didn't have to think too hard and everything was funny like Larry says "i don't care who you are right there, now thats funny" It seems like most people just didn't like it because it had toilet humor, and i know its still funny to everyone it has been since we were five and it always will be, i don't care how sophisticated you think you are!

movie_name: Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
review_title: Good film - not as bad as the reviewers say.
review_detailed_main:
Anytime a movie whips by without my noticing, it's a good movie. Larry the Cable guy's movie did just that.

Larry made me laugh. It was warm-hearted and tender.

What's wrong with that?

These so-called critics who loved '40-year old Virgin have somehow brain-washed the masses again into believing movies with 'heartland' or 'middle America' must be mocked at. I'm getting tired of the people who love 'Borat', but won't make room for other types of humor. It's my way or the highway.

I say, 'forget them'. Forget the critics. They're mostly jerks who never made a film.

These so-called critics annoy me. Have you noticed they all sound the same? They have the cynical, abrasive personality that you see on talk shows. This is what this country is headed.

What made Larry the Cable Guy a great film was it never once made me bored.

movie_name: Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
review_detailed_main:
imagine this, a redneck hillbilly working in a big city. That is tough to do.But only Larry the Cable Guy could pull this one off. OK,it is not the blue collar comedy tour, but i give him credit to try and venture off the stage and into Hollywood.

I thought it was pretty funny. But if you have never watched Larry the cable guy before,

then you probably would not enjoy this film.

But if you are a backyard redneck hillbilly or a good old country boy or gal than you will

enjoy this film. A must see. Larry is funnier

than Jeff Foxworthy. GIT-R-DONE.

movie_name: Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
review_title: It's funnier than watching midgets run track
review_detailed_main:
Well, I must say that I'm disappointed in many of the posts I've seen here regarding Larry The Cable Guy. People who make it their life-long dreams to insult Larry at all costs are just those people who are too uptight to giggle a little. Really, his humor is just immature, which I find funny because it reminds me of the jokes my friends and I used to laugh about in junior high and high school. Many people still find that type of humor funny. For instance, "Man, I don't know what I ate, but I could sh** through a screen door and not touch a single wire!" Tell me that's not funny. It is crude, but still rates a good belly-laugh.

So, why do people not like Larry? It's not because of the humor, it is because they don't like Larry's politics AND his method of speaking his mind. Why is it if a liberal tells jokes and speaks his/her mind it's hilarious and if a conservative tells jokes and speaks his/her mind, it's not funny- it's bigoted and racist? It's not the jokes. In my opinion, it's the attitude of the listener. For example, how many people who comment negatively on this movie have actually seen it? If we took a survey, I would venture to guess that a majority of people who did comment negatively have never seen it! And why is that? It's because they have been polluted by every liberal media outlet across the globe and whatever anybody who thinks differently than a liberal is automatically a racist and a bigot.

Furthermore, those individuals who seek out to insult redneck humor just don't get the culture. But again, I really don't expect them to. They accuse us of being close-minded and freedom of speech for them is only a one-way street. They can say whatever they want (no matter how absurd it is) and if a conservative speaks out, then it's bad and we're suddenly the worst evil scum in the world.

So here's a message to "those" people: if you haven't seen the movie, you really shouldn't be voting on it. That's like asking a retard to go beat up Jackie Chan! It doesn't make sense to go do something like that. Would you wipe before you poop? NO!

movie_name: Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
review_title: Pass Gas but don't pass on this movie
review_detailed_main:
Another Cole Swier review:

"Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector" is an absolute gem of a comedy film. With Larry's signature humor and his unique approach to health inspections, this movie delivers non-stop laughter from start to finish. The film's witty one-liners and hilarious situations keep you entertained throughout. Larry's character is endearing, and his antics in the world of health inspections are nothing short of side-splitting. The supporting cast adds to the comedic charm, making it a perfect ensemble. If you're in need of a good laugh and appreciate Larry's brand of comedy, this movie is a solid 10 out of 10, and a must-watch for anyone looking for pure, unadulterated fun!

I Cole Swier personally guarantee you will love this movie.
